Articles.Content:
Stock. 15kdV and flies great. Looks to die for. What's not to like...

![YVTe4yO.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/YVTe4yO.jpg)

![dOsI7x4.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/dOsI7x4.jpg)

![AoOYcHM.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/AoOYcHM.jpg)

Craft file: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/fqr2wxus79d2g29/Rocket%20ship%202.craft?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/fqr2wxus79d2g29/Rocket%20ship%202.craft?dl=0)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-06T07:16:44Z" title="03/06/2015 07:16  AM" data-short="9 yr">March 6, 2015</time> by Foxster**
WOW! I would NEVER had thought of doing THAT!!! Great job!

Cheers! 

It was pure luck but that third picture is just soooo cool and so KSP.

> 
> Cheers! 
> It was pure luck but that third picture is just soooo cool and so KSP.

That it is, and the location is the same as most of my Mun landings...inclined!
That's amazing. Using wings as both staging devices and landing legs! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Looks like a George Pal spaceship. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Looks like a George Pal spaceship. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Yup or TinTin's rocket.

I love the retro-sci-fi look!

And inventive use of air-intakes!

> 
> Yup or TinTin's rocket.

Someone called?

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/0FGSO)

Nice looking rocket by the way, OP. Mine is "only" a chemical SSTO, so Mun travels require a fuel depot in LKO... with a Klaw. And it doesn't even have RCS to maneuver to a dock. Ok, it may not be the most useful design I've made... ![^_^](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_happy.png)'

Rune. Sometimes you build something pretty just for the sake of it.

> 
> Stock. 15kdV and flies great. Looks to die for. What's not to like...

You sir have used the correct flag. I also love the chunky retro styling.

I'd +rep you only, apparently, I need to spread some more around.

(Does it actually carry crew though?)

> 
> (Does it actually carry crew though?)

Yup, that's a two-man lander can on the bottom. Means they can disembark without climbing the length of the ship.
The can detaches and has a couple of 'chutes for a low-dV landing at Kerbin.

I'm thinking of making a couple more with extra utility - cargo bay etc.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-06T15:54:55Z" title="03/06/2015 03:54  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 6, 2015</time> by Foxster**
Brilliant craft Foxster ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Awesome! I've thought of doing a rocket in that style before but I wasn't able to pull off a good look without infinite fuel to go anywhere. Because people are posting, I made this remake of the tintin rocket around the time of the Kerbal Cup last year. It a pain to land well XD.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/o30cc)

Purdy :3 - And simple looking. I did my best to make it look simple from the outside.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-02T20:00:17Z" title="04/02/2015 08:00  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 2, 2015</time> by Avera9eJoe**

Nice one.

Here's my rocket's big-ass cargo-carrying brother...

![lVjWSV3.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/lVjWSV3.jpg)

Yes, its all stock.

![PQyDtyx.png](http://i.imgur.com/PQyDtyx.png)

Ok, it may not be the most useful design I've made... ![^_^](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_happy.png)'

> Rune. Sometimes you build something pretty just for the sake of it.

I love those comics!

(Didn't the moon rocket have a nuclear engine too?)

EDIT:

Got epicly ninja'd

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-02T20:38:08Z" title="04/02/2015 08:38  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 2, 2015</time> by Mad Rocket Scientist**

> Nice one.

Woah! It's beautiful!

> 
> Woah! It's beautiful!

Cheers. Its part of my "I'm bored with staging rockets to get to orbit" period.

So, how would you progress to this in a career path, keeping to the same idea as the 50's style?

Love them, gave you rep.

> 
> You sir have used the correct flag. I also love the chunky retro styling.
> I'd +rep you only, apparently, I need to spread some more around.
> 
> (Does it actually carry crew though?)

Lander can under the nukes. Not what I'd call a safe location, but its there.

> 
> Lander can under the nukes. Not what I'd call a safe location, but its there.

After a short trip Jeb was heard to say, "Look, Valentina. My thingy glows in the dark!"

> 
> After a short trip Jeb was heard to say, "Look, Valentina. My thingy glows in the dark!"

and after another trip, Jeb never spoke again

This spacecraft got showcased in the space craft of the month. Since I loved it I made this.

![1d2wjky.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/1d2wjky.jpg)

I still mess around with variations of this. 

I decided a little while ago to make a pre-atomic version...

![7PZiF8b.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/7PZiF8b.jpg)

![KCBQu5N.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/KCBQu5N.jpg)

Was a bit of an odd launch. Seems someone left a tap on...

![bjcn4Vq.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/bjcn4Vq.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-23T21:56:13Z" title="04/23/2015 09:56  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 23, 2015</time> by Foxster**

The concept of just landing a retro-looking rocket on the Mun has drastically inspired me. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Huge idea that just came to mind. Thank you. I got a very good idea... Its something epic.
Whoops...forgot to say...very nice picture, ghostbuzzer7!
